text: The Brook Hill School is an independent, Christian day and boarding school for students in grades PreK-12 located in Bullard just south of Tyler, Texas. The school began in 1997 with thirty-one students and the boarding school began in 2003. Today the school exists on with over 675 students from East Texas and around the world with 21 countries represented among its student population. Brook Hill also houses the American Freedom Museum, which houses artifacts from all periods of American history. The museum is open to the general public on Wednesdays and Saturdays, and to tour groups of 15 or more on all other days except Sunday when it is closed entirely. ==Accreditation== SACS: Southern Association of Colleges & Schoolshttp://www.advanc- ed.org/oasis2/u/par/accreditation/summary?institutionId=20750 ==School Awards== 2012-2013 Henderson Cup Champions, making Brook Hill the overall best school in the state of Texas, TAPPS division 3A for Academics, Athletics, and Fine Arts. ===State Championships=== *Boys Baseball - 2004, 2011, 2012, 2013 *Boys Golf - 2010, 2011, 2013 and 2014 *Boys Football - 2011 *Girls Soccer - 2013, 2014 ==References== Category:Schools in Smith County, Texas Category:Private K-12 schools in Texas Category:Preparatory schools in Texas Category:Boarding schools in Texas Category:Christian schools in Texas
